title.narrative: Climate Envelope 2013: UNDP - UN REDD 2014-2016 (3 years)

description.narrative: The objective of the REDD+ programmes is to reduce emission from deforestation and forest degradation through enhancing the capacity of forest rich developing countries to address the multiple challenges associated with reducing emissions while sustaining economic growth and improving the livelihood of indigenous peoples and other forest dependent communities. The programmes are addressing sustainable forest management in the wider context of climate change, conservation, green growth and competition for land from especially agriculture. The REDD+ program is targeting policy makers and implementers from both public and private sector and aim at fully involving the directly affected communities. The intended outcomes are national forest and landscape management plans being implemented by capacitated national public institutions with support and involvement of climate change and sustainability conscious private sector actors.
